---
title: "Origin of the TEs - repeat 2"
output: github_document
---
# Why Repeat 2?
I used an older RepeatMasking library; Great now i can repeat everything with the common library

# Question
Which Drosophila species is the origin of blood, opus, 412.
Since I address this question already for three TEs, I will extend it to all Dmel TEs.

# Analyis
## Obtain genomes

```{bash eval=FALSE}
datasets download genome accession PRJNA675888
unzip ncbi_dataset.zip  
mv **/*.fna .
ll *.fna| perl -pe 's/^/#/'
```

### Create the renaming bash script

**NOTE** Also converts all characters into upper case; Just to be sure, I want to avoid RepeatMasker issues that something may not be masked because it is already masked (lower case means masked)

First the code of the renamer.py; this python script generates a bash script
```{Python eval=FALSE}
import sys
output="/Users/rokofler/analysis/dmel_TE_invasions/2023-04-origin-101-genomes-ro-2/raw/genomes"
ct="fasta-reader.py {0} | fasta-formatter.py --upper |fasta-writter.py > {1}/{2}"

for name in sys.stdin:
	ifile,ofile =name.rstrip("\n").split(" ")
	com=ct.format(ifile,output,ofile)
	print(com)%
```

```{bash eval=FALSE}
cat rename/rename.txt|python rename/renamer.py|zsh
```

### Prepare Repeat Library
Get rid of the single-copy-genes
```{bash eval=FALSE}
fasta-reader.py teseqs-3scg-dmel.fasta | grep -v Dmel | fasta-writter.py > ../2023-04-origin-101-genomes-ro-2/teseqs.fasta    
# how many TEs are left
cat ../2023-04-origin-101-genomes-ro/teseqs.fasta|grep '^>'|wc
#     180     180    1438
```

## RepeatMask them all
Executed on vetgrid27
```{bash eval=FALSE}
for i in *.fa; do RepeatMasker -pa 20 -no_is -s -nolow -dir out -lib repeatlibrary/teseqs.fasta $i;done  
```
## Merge the repeatmasked files and append file name at the end
Executed on vetgrid27
```{bash eval=FALSE}
awk '{print $0,FILENAME}' *.ori.out|perl -pe 's/\.fa\.ori\.out//' >merged-101.ori.out 
```
Then transfer to my iMac with sftp
